fields.description:
h3. Summary

It would be great to support native apps and allow custom scheme callback URL in 3LO. Sample URL: foo3://myapplication/oauth

Feature requested in Devhelp: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-2864
fields.summary: Allow custom scheme callback URL in 3LO

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
ASCII characters can be rendered by Jira.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a string of text that has the "\u001b" character;
 # Create a comment with it;

Video: https://cl.ly/6b389b315500
h3. Expected Results
The character will be rendered correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The character is not rendered and the UI shows an error message indicating a connection problem.

h3. Notes
The character is used to create colors on terminal output.
This error occurred even if I put the text block as a code block.
Also, the ASCII character does not show up in the text input (it is invisible). It does show up in certain editors. Making the problem even more confusing.
The character "\u001e" also causes this bug

h3. Workaround
The only workaround is to use a text converter, such as http://www.unit-conversion.info/texttools/replace-text/
fields.summary: When having the ASCII characters used in a comment in Jira, users get an error indicating a connection problem

fields.description:
Currently, there is a limitation to get more than 1000 assignable user. 


Using *startAt* parameter to set page offset for [Fine Users|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-user-search-get] REST API only works for first 1000 users. It does not return users with index more than 1000.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add more than 1000 active users (e.g 1100 users)
# Run following curl command to use [Find Users|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-user-search-get] REST API to get list of users:
{code}
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://<siteName>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user/search?startAt=1000&maxResults=100&query' \
  --header 'Authorization: Basic <email:apitoken(base64encoded)>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{code}

{code}
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://<siteName>.atlassian.net/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?project=<Project Name>&maxResults=1000&startAt=1000' \
  --header 'Authorization: Basic <email:apitoken(base64encoded)>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Assuming there are >=1100 users in the site, this call should return list of users from index 1000 to index 1100

h3. Actual Results
It returns no result

h3. Notes
This works for users with index less than 1000, for example following curl command works fine:
{code}
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://<siteName>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user/search?startAt=100&maxResults=100&query' \
  --header 'Authorization: Basic <email:apitoken(base64encoded)>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{code}
fields.summary: Required rest api to fetch more than 1000 assignable user with page startat offset

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the old view, if you hover over the assignee, or reporter, a pop-up of the user will be displayed.

But, if you click on the assignee (or on the reporter), the pop-up will not disappear once you get the cursor out of the user's name. If you scroll down a bit, the pop-up will get hidden behind the left sidebar.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Hover over the assignee, or the reporter;
 * Click on the assignee (or reporter).

See the recording: [^User profile pop-up.mp4]
h3. Expected Results

The pop-up will disappear after getting the cursor out of the user's name.
h3. Actual Results

The pop-up will not disappear.
h3. Workaround

Click the ESC key or click outside of the profile card.
fields.summary: User profile pop-up in the issue (old) view will not disappear

fields.description:
It'd be useful to allow users to create Next-Gen software projects for personal use, or for smaller projects, but having any (JSD) licensed user create a Service Desk Next-Gen can be detrimental, as their projects would also be shown on the portal if not configured properly.

*Suggestion*: 
Divide the Global permission to be two more specific permissions, for each type of project.
fields.summary: Separate Next-Gen Service Desk and Software projects on the "Create next-gen projects" Global Permission

fields.description:
h2. Description

When there are field validators on the create issue transition for the sub-task's workflow, Jira prompts a screen (for that you be able to edit the validated fields) when creating the sub-task. If you change the name of the "Create" to anything else (only possible on custom workflows). This screen won't appear and the sub-task creation will fail in the validation

h2. Steps to reproduce

# Create a custom workflow
# Edit the create transition name to something else than 'Create'
# Insert validators in the create transition
# Activate this workflow to be used with sub-tasks
# Try creating the sub-task

h2. Expected Behavior

Jira to prompt a screen for that you insert the fields and be able to create the sub-task

h2. Actual Behavior
*Sub-task is not created*

Jira's UI throws a generic error 

h3. Workaround
Use old issue view
fields.summary: Sub-task creation fails if the create transition is renamed and has validators

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

App switcher redirects the user to an invalid link when access the *People* link via the administration page. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to site administration https://<site>.atlassian.net/admin
 # Use the app switcher and access People

h3. Expected Results

The people link should redirect the user to https://<site>.atlassian.net/people

h3. Actual Results

The people link redirects the user to https://admin.atlassian.com/people (invalid link)


h3. Workaround

Open Jira or Confluence and access the people link from the app switcher.
fields.summary: App switcher generates and incorrect link

fields.description:
In our dev teams (and I'm sure many others), we often share our Jira board during standups so that the team can see what everyone is working on and what the status of each issue is.

However, the board has a lot of information on it which, if being viewed over a video call or on a TV screen, is difficult to read and makes the important information about the issue difficult to discern. Not only that, but the board itself only fills two-thirds of the page, and real estate on the screen is taken up by the header and the sidebar.

It would be great if users could toggle a 'standup' or 'presentation' mode for the sprint board which shows only the board, has larger text, has some of the information filtered out to reduce noise, and perhaps has a high contrast ratio so it's easier to see on a TV or a video call. Sort of like a 'Reading view', but for the sprint board.
fields.summary: Have a "standup" view for the sprint board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The developer tools panel in the New Issue View doesn't refresh after OAUTH dance



h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go here: (e.g https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue-key>?devStatusDetailDialog=repository)
!image-2019-09-20-18-10-51-297.png|thumbnail! 

(You are now redirected to a new tab)

 # Click Allow: 
!image-2019-09-20-18-11-02-816.png|thumbnail! 

# The new tab will close sending the user back to Jira.

h3. Expected Results
The Developer Panel in Jira will refresh showing data from Bitbucket Server

h3. Actual Results
The Developer Panel doesn't refresh and requires the user to refresh the page. 

h3. Workaround
* Use Old Issue view
or
* Refresh the New Issue View page
fields.summary: New Issue View: Developer tools panel doesn't refresh after OAUTH dance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. 
  {panel}

*Problem*
Unable to monitor the email connectivity to the default cloud mail server.

Connectivity logs are available for default email accounts for JSD projects. 
Same way, connectivity logs should also be made available for default cloud mail server under global mail settings for incoming emails.
fields.summary: Connectivity logs for default mail server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira workflow condition does not respect users configured in the default project role. 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Project roles and create a new project role
# Add yourself as default members to the role
# Now go to workflow and select a transition
# Add the conditon "User Is In Any Project Role	- Condition to allow only users in a given project role to execute a transition."
# Select the project role created earlier
# Publish the workflow
# Create a new issue
# Try to transition the status you added the condition on

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to transition the status since you're a default member of the project role.

h3. Actual Results
You are unable to transition the status.

h3. Workaround
Add yourself or the affected user to the project role in people page.
fields.summary: Workflow condition does not respect default project role

fields.description: The new user profile hover is degrading our user experience. It's popping up way too much as we work on Issues. We are seeing zero value in this new feature and more frustrated users. The hover is disrupting user flows. This feature needs the ability to be disabled by the user or throttled by a mouse wait, like 1-2 seconds.
fields.summary: New Profile Hover degrades UX, need a way to disable or throttle

fields.description:
h3. Description
When creating tasks in the old issue view, a popup message is displayed containing a *link* to the new issue. When creating sub-tasks, however, the popup message *does not* include a link to the newly created sub-task.

It would be nice if this notification included a link, so that users could easily access the newly created sub-task upon creation.

h3. Current behavior
||Task||Sub-task||
| !Screen Shot 2019-09-19 at 3.52.11 PM.png|thumbnail! | !Screen Shot 2019-09-19 at 3.55.51 PM.png|thumbnail! |
fields.summary: Sub-task Creation Popup should include link to newly created issue

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Dashboards directly: https://hello.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa
# Go to Projects (SPA transition)
# Try to use g + d shortcut.

h3. Expected Results

You'll be redirected to the Dashboard.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing will happen

h3. Workaround

- Refresh the page and the shortcut will work.
fields.summary: Dashboard shortcut 'g+d' stopped working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When running a JQL search, the "changed by" function does not work if the username's case is not matched exactly

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Jira and go to *Search issues*
 # Run the JQL search below:
 #* *{{status changed by lHubert ORDER BY updated}}*

h3. Expected Results
The correct results should be returned

h3. Actual Results
An error message saying "The user 'lHubert' does not exist and cannot be used in the 'by' predicate." is returned.

h3. Notes
The query above only works if the username is provided in *lower case letters*:
* *{{status changed by lhubert ORDER BY updated}}*

h3. Workaround
Use lower case letters only
fields.summary: "Changed By" JQL function should not be case sensitive

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Allow Jira issue to display the age of ticket by # of days
fields.summary: Show Age of Ticket

fields.description: In a Jira issue, clicking the calendar icon in the datetime-picker opens just the time-picker. This can be confusing to the user, so we suggest improving usability in this area.
fields.summary: Calendar icon functionality in date/time picker

fields.description: When organizing issues within the backlog the user is unable to remove a parent link. They need to open the issue then use the change parent option. Only then are they offered the option to remove.
fields.summary: Add Remove Parent Link to Backlog view

fields.description: As a customer using the old issue view, I find the process to reorder sub-tasks too slow as it reloads the page every time a sub-task is moved up or down.
fields.summary: Apply Sub-Task reordering as the old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Introduce the option disable share issue option.

h3. Suggested Solution
Disable share issue option.

h3. Why this is important
Customers do not want users to share issues.
fields.summary: Ability to disable share issue option

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the new Jira issue view is enabled, there will be an icon for Issue Linking in the board. Searching any text in the Link Issue box doesn't return any result.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Enable new Jira issue view from Profile
# Go to the the board and click on Issue Link icon
# Key in any text to search for any existing issue

h3. Actual Result
No issues can be found.

h3. Expected Result
It should return the related issues.

h3. Workaround
Disable the new Jira issue view from Profile or switch to the old issue view
fields.summary: Issue Linking doesn't show result in new Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding attachments to issues by either *dragging and dropping* files into fields (e.g. description, comment) or by using the *Add Files & Images* button fails intermittently without any errors.

h3. Environment
This problem can be reproduced when using Jira's *new issue view*, in *Firefox*, using *Linux*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect to Jira using Firefox in Linux
# Open an issue (*New issue view* must be enabled)
# Drag and Drop a file into the *description* or into a new *comment*

h3. Expected Results
File upload progress bar is displayed and file is uploaded

h3. Actual Results
The file is not uploaded and no errors are returned. Also, a progress bar is not presented.
*  [^Screen+Recording+2019-09-16+at+11.53+AM.mov] 

h3. Workaround
This problem does not seem to occur when using the *old issue view*. Also, other OS' doesn't seem to have this problem.

Using *Google Chrome* instead of Firefox is also a workaround.
fields.summary: Uploading attachments in New Issue View fails intermittently in Linux

fields.description:
Copy and paste the Issue Key in the new issue view adds the text "copy current issue url".

*Steps to Reproduce:*
 * In the new issue view, navigate to any issue
 * Copy the Issue Key text:

        !Screen Shot 2019-09-17 at 17.02.42.png|width=330,height=182!        
 * Past it anywhere

 

*Expected Results:*

The text of the issue key ([TEST-14|https://petterkrumen.atlassian.net/browse/TEST-14]) should be pasted.

 

*Actual Results:*

The following text is added:

[TEST-14|https://petterkrumen.atlassian.net/browse/TEST-14]
copy current issue url
fields.summary: Copy/paste the Issue Key in the new view add a "copy current issue url" to the text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can determine contexts to custom fields, such as: project(s), issue type(s).

In the new view, instead of not being displayed at all, any field that's out of context will be briefly displayed when the page loads.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Restrict the context of a custom field (e.g. by issue type(s), hide the field, etc.):
 !restrcit context.png|thumbnail! 
* Set that custom field in the screen(s) of a project;
* Access an issue whose issue type is not part of the contexts associated to that custom field.

h3. Expected Results

The field will not be displayed at all.

h3. Actual Results

The field is briefly displayed in the screen:  [^Field_briefly_displayed.mp4] 

h3. Notes

That behaviour may occur with the *Time tracking* field if you switch to use a different time tracking provider.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Field that's out of context is briefly displayed in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user is viewing their backlog in Jira cloud, they can click a story to have the legacy sidebar detail view appear.  Users can then view the Assigned User and click to edit.  If you click on the field it will open a dialog with the user's information.
However, if you remove the user from the story, or click away from the sidebar, the panel does not dismiss itself.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a story in the backlog.
# Assign a user
# Click the story in the legacy sidebar
# Click the assigned user
# The panel with the user information will appear
# Delete the user from the story.

h3. Expected Results
Clicking away from the panel should make the dialog disappear.

h3. Actual Results
The panel persists, for example, if you on another story in the backlog, the panel still persists

h3. Workaround
Reload the page.
fields.summary: Clicking on the User Profile of the Assignee Field in the Backlog open a Dialog that Never Disappears

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In Jira Cloud, when inserting links from certain services (e.g. Box.com, Microsoft Onedrive, Dropbox, Google Drive, Invision, Trello, Bitbucket, Github, etc.) the link is automatically converted to a Smart Card link.

This occurs even when attempting to insert a link as a text link only.

For some of these services, a message, *{color:#0747A6}Connect your account to preview links{color}*, displays.

h4. Problem
Many users do not want to use the Smart Card behavior here or do not wish to connect their accounts. They simply want to insert a link to the resources.

h4. Solution
# In the Link menu, provide the ability to disable Smart Card behavior for that link specifically, _*or*_
# Provide a way to dismiss the *{color:#0747A6}Connect your account to preview links{color}* message besides connecting your account.

h4. Workaround
When inserting the link, be sure to use {{http://}} instead of {{https://}}. The Smart Card feature will not be activated, and upon visiting the URL, it will automatically redirect to {{https://}} for these services.

Alternatively, you can press Ctrl + Z (Windows) or Cmd + Z (macOS) (to revert the link to a normal blue link).


h4. Alternative Workaround
Set the affected field to *Default text renderer*. For more information: [Configuring Renderers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-renderers-776636458.html]

(!) {color:#DE350B}When setting a field to Default text renderer, wiki-style rendering will no longer be possible.{color} 

The default text renderer renders a field's content as plain text, with the exception of Jira links and web links. An HTML link will automatically be generated to link to these locations.
fields.summary: Ability to dismiss or disable Smart Card behavior for links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the new issue view, whenever you paste a link on the Description or comment field, Jira initiates a Smart Link that will attempt to preview this link.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue on the *New Issue view*, paste a Github link either on the comment or description
 # Save and try to open the link by right clicking.

h3. Expected Results
The link should be able to be opened when right clicking.

h3. Actual Results
No option to open the link when right clicking  as a link is not present for the rendered Smart Link. There's no "*a*" element with a "*href*" attribute to show that a link is present when checking on the Dev Console.


h3. Workaround

* Use *Ctrl + Click*  or *Cmd + Click* on the rendered link to open on new tab.
bq. OR
* Use *Ctrl + Z*  or *Cmd + Z* to prevent the link from rendering prior to saving it.
fields.summary: Smart Link not opening to a New tab with Github Links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Trello Importer produces 500 Error

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the External System Importer
# Select the Trello option
# Click on *Next*

h3. Expected Results
Trello Importer works as intended

h3. Actual Results
{code}Error type: 500 - Internal server error
Log reference: 14d4cec8-0fca-4320-af77-96b0b24370d8{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no direct workaround, though imports are still possible through CSV or JSON
 - [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-csv-776636762.html]
 - [Importing data from JSON|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-json-776636779.html]
fields.summary: Utilizing the Trello Importer produces 500 Error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this moment, it is not possible to control the sub-task (assigne, edit, rank, etc) or child issues (inside Epics) from the parent issue using the "New Jira issue view", as it could before. The video below better demonstrates this feature currently: [^JRACLOUD-72328.mp4]

In the old issue view, the feature had more options as the image below:
 !Image 2020-10-08 at 9.14.37 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the *More •••* on each sub-task, while viewing them from the parent issue, like before. Another possible approach would be having the ability to drag and drop to reorder issues inside Epics or Stories with Sub-Tasks.
h3. Why this is important

This should improve the experience for users using the "New Jira issue view".
h3. Workaround 
 # Users can either click on the sub-task to access it directly and then edit it accordingly or;
 # Users can disable the "New Jira issue view" for now, by:
 ## Clicking the profile icon, on the bottom of the left sidebar, then *Settings* under "JIRA";
 ## On the "Jira Labs" section, clicking to disable the *New Jira issue view*.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to control the sub-task or child issues (assign, edit, rank, etc) from the parent view as I could before

fields.description:
Currently, if I create a status with more than 15 characters, the status name gets truncated and don't show the full status name.
I'd like to be able to use long status names and have all the information displayed.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to use longer status names and that Jira wraps the name

fields.description:
Currently, it's possible to log into Jira using email/password or your Google account. I would like the ability to choose which of these options will be available for the users in my instance.

For example, I would like to make "Log in with Google" the only available option.

!print.png|width=253,height=297!
fields.summary: Ability to manage login options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, it is possible to update a Sub-task's issue type via CSV (that has already been reported [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72979]).

But, if you then move that modified Sub-task to another project, and then create a new Sub-task under the same issue (the parent), you will not be able to move the current parent issue to another project.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create two issues: *A* and *B*;
 * Create a link between *A* and *B* (e.g. relates to);
 * Convert *B* to sub-task, selecting *A* as the parent;
 * Change *B*'s issue type to a standard issue type;
 * Move *B* to a different project;
 * Create a new sub-task under *A*;
 * Try to move *A* to another project.

h3. Expected Results

*A* will be moved to another project successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Jira will not be able to move *A*, stating an error message: *At least one of the issues you are trying to move has been recently updated by another user (<issue key>). Please cancel and start again.*

Error message below:
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-16 at 13.18.31.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Convert *A*'s sub-task to issue, move *A*, then move that sub-task you've converted to the same project. After moving that sub-task you've converted to the same project where *A* is now, convert it to sub-task again, selecting *A* as the parent.
fields.summary: Cannot move issue if there was a parent/child relation with another non-sub-task issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to update a Sub-task's issue type via CSV, but even though you change its issue type to a *Standard* one, the parent/child relation will be kept between the parent issue and the Sub-task you've just updated.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a CSV file with the columns that will reffer to:
** *Issue type:* the name of a standard issue type (non-sub-task;
** *Issue key:* the key of the Sub-task you want to update;
** *Summary:* this column will be empty;
** Here's an example file:  [^update issue.csv] 

h3. Expected Results

Either it should not be able to directly change the issue type of a Sub-task (which the UI does not offer as an option unless there is another Sub-task issue type), or the parent/child relation should not be kept.

h3. Actual Results

Jira keeps a parent/child relation between the two issues.

See the example:
 !parent view.png|thumbnail!  !child view.png|thumbnail!  !standard issuetype.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Moving the child issue to a different project will remove it from the parent view as a sub-task.

But, that may still cause other problems, such as this one: [Cannot move issue if there was a parent/child relation with another non-sub-task issue|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72980].
fields.summary: Update a Sub-task's issue type via CSV
Adding a "Regular Expression Check" validator having the user default language set to Spanish can't be configured

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Restricting a custom field to an issue type, but leaving the project context to "Global context" causes the field to not be selectable via Issue Naviagator.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a custom field context
# Restrict the issue type context to an issue type(or multiple issue types)
 !Screenshot 2019-09-13 at 22.12.06.png|thumbnail! 
# Leave the project context on "Global context"
# Go to Issue Navigator, filter by an appropriate issue type and try to filter by that custom field - ensure that "Project" filter is set to "All"

h3. Expected Results
* The custom field is selectable
* The custom field should be selectable if the custom field context allows the field to be searchable on all projects

h3. Actual Results
* The custom field can't be selected due to the message: "<custom_field_name> is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type."
 !Screenshot 2019-09-13 at 22.11.46.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3. Workaround
* Clear the issue type field context entirely
fields.summary: Issue Navigator: "<custom_field_name> is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type" message displayed if project context is global, but issue type is restricted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Logging time in Spanish can log time incorrectly.

h3. Environment

Set user preferences to have Spanish language

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Log 2.5 hours on an issue

h3. Expected Results

It logs 2.5 hours

h3. Actual Results

It logs 25 hours.

h3. Workaround

Logging time as 2h 30m will work correctly.
fields.summary: When logging time in Spanish it can log it incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating an issue using Google Chrome on MacOS, the shortcut for "Numbered List" on the description field will trigger an incognito window in the browser. The following video better demonstrates this behaviour:

 [^JRACLOUD-72974.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Be sure to use Google Chrome;
# Hit "C" to create a new issue;
# Access the "Description" field (or other text field with wiki renderer);
# Trigger the shortcut to add a "Numbered List" (Command + Shift + N).

h3. Expected Results
A new "Numbered List" is created.

h3. Actual Results
A new incognito windows of Google Chrome is opened.

h3. Workaround
Instead of using "Command + Shift + N", use Mac's "Control + Shift + N".
fields.summary: When creating an issue using Google Chrome on MacOS, the shortcut for "Numbered List" will trigger an incognito window

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira sends Slack notification for issue transition events when it has not been configured
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Jira Cloud
 * Slack

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Jira Slack integration within a Project to a slack channel
 # Select Issue Created event only for the "SEND A MESSAGE TO THE CHANNEL WHEN" option
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Create an Issue and Transition the issue

h3. Expected Results
 # Jira sends a notification when an issue is created

h3. Actual Results
 # Jira sends a notification when an issue is created and issue transitioned

h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

No available workaround
fields.summary: Jira sends Slack notification for transition events when it has not been configured

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Based on [Gmail v/s Google Mail – The Difference Explained|https://gmailgeek.com/facts/gmail-vs-google-mail-the-difference-explained.html] documentation, its known Gmail user by default have two email account which is gmail and googlemail email. Both emails are the same user and shared the same inbox. However, from JIRA end, we recognize it as two different accounts. It will be causing an issue to issue creation or issue comment via email. For example, issue created by gmail.com user and googlemail.com user send an email to add a comment. It will end up creating a new ticket as he doesn't have permission to add comment to the existing ticket.

h3. Suggested Solution
Recognize email abc@gmail.com and abc@googlemail.com is the same account.

h3. Why this is important
User not required to create two accounts.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Able to recognize Gmail.com email is the same account with Googlemail.com email
Curly Brackets "{ }" is displayed on the New Issue View after performing Jira import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User status still displays "Invitation Pending" even after the user already completed the registration from the invitation email they received.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As site-admin , invite a user
 # Go to the user email inbox, he should receive invitation email from JIRA
# Complete the registration and login to the instance.

h3. Expected Results
User status from User Management page doesn't show "Invitation Pending"

h3. Actual Results
User status from User Management page show "Invitation Pending"

h3. Notes
It will not affect the user login.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User status from User Management still display "Invitation Pending" even after complete the account registration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The batched notifications get all changes of one issue into a single email. However, if the customer is working (or watching) a lot of issues, the customer will still receive a lot of emails daily

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be helpful to have batched notifications for different issues as well. To receive a summary of all issues you is part of it in a single email


h3. Why this is important

To reduce the number of emails the customers receives all day.
fields.summary: Batched notifications for changes in different issues

fields.description:
h3. Description
It would be nice if the window for the work description when inserting a work log was wider, as the old issue view.

In the new issue view, it is necessary to break lines to insert all the content that, in the old view, could be inserted in just one line.
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-12 at 18.11.11.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-12 at 18.11.37.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Make the window for the work description for the 'Work Log', in the new issue view, more wide as the old view

fields.description: Similar to the check box that stops an automation rule from starting another automation, I need the ability that if one automation kicks off, no other automations will be run.
fields.summary: Need the ability to stop processing automation rules for certain Automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When saving a comment with multiple attachments, the save button idle and do not allow saving,

h3. Environment
 * Production Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  Create an issue from the new issue view
 # Upload multiple files to a comment or description fields.
 # Select the "save" button when uploading the files.
 # This does not allow you to save.
 # In the same scenario, we could see an error message such as:
{quote}(x) *We couldn't save your comment*
 It might be empty, too long, or have invalid
 formatting. If you copy-pasted, try removing the
 formatting and adding it directly in the editor.
{quote}

h3. Expected Results
 * Allow to click save to store the data from the comment box,

h3. Actual Results
 * Save idle 

h3. Workaround

Wait for media upload to finish uploading the file before you click on "saves"
fields.summary: Saving comment with multiple files on new issue view does not allow saving

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Multiple comments in issue if user don't exist in outlook distribution list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a distribution list as a watcher in the issue.
# One of the emails in the Distribution list must be invalid.
# Add comment to the issue.
# Bounce back is added as a comment to the ticket.
# Multiple bounce backs are added as comments in a loop.

h3. Expected Results
Bounce back mails should not be added as comments

h3. Actual Results
Bounce back mails are added as comments

h3. Workaround
enable *Exclude email header 'Precedence: bulk'* option
[Configuring JIRA application options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/configuring-jira-application-options-861253962.html]
fields.summary: When mail is sent to a distribution list and there is a bounce back from one of the mails, Jira will add infinite comments in issue

fields.description: For issue types fields customization there is no way to set fields as mandatory
fields.summary: Mandatory Fields

fields.description:
Would like to be able to customize or remove the 'Suggested Projects' in the cloud version.

Many of our users would like to customize the suggested projects section and some don't want to see it at all.
fields.summary: Would like to be able to customize or remove the 'Suggested Projects' in the cloud version.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you upload an attachment using the new view, it may not be kept, or you may not be able to preview it.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* From a board, attach a file;
* Close the issue, and get back to it;
* You will see that the attachment is not there anymore, but if you click to attach a file again, that same file will be in the recent uploads, but it will work properly now if you select it.

There are some different use cases for that problem:
* If you upload a new file, and click on *Insert file* without waiting for the progress bar/upload to be completed. In this one, the file will be gone after you get back to it:  [^Docx quick insert file.mp4];
* If you upload a new file, and wait for the upload to be completed before clicking on *Insert file*:  [^Docx file full upload waiting.mp4]  

h3. Expected Results

The file should be available in the issue after you come back to it. And you should be able to preview it even after the upload.

h3. Actual Results

You cannot preview the file after the upload, and the file will be gone from the issue after you come back to it.

h3. Notes

I've replicated that behaviour with the following extensions so far:
* Docx;
* Xlsx.

The biggest part of the occasions where I've replicated it, was on Next-gen projects. It looks to happen way less often in Classic projects.

Also, most of the occasions are on the detail view from the board. But I did get to replicate it in full view in some rare occasions.

If you upload a file after an unsuccessful one, the file that was affected will be fixed:  [^Next upload.mp4] 

If you do not removed that affected file before selecting it back from the recent uploads, you may end up with a duplicate:  [^Cannot preview file.mp4] 

Usually, the file affected by such problem will have the following highlighted icon on it:  !Screen Shot 2019-09-11 at 15.22.13.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Select the file from the recent uploads. 

Uploading a new file will fix the affected file automatically (although the new one may be affected).
fields.summary: Attachments uploaded via the new view will not be retained by the issues

fields.description:
Currently, when we disable the Outgoing email, it does not show any information about what will not work.
We understand that notifications won't be sent, but recently on [this thread in community|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/How-can-Customers-prompt-Forgotten-Password-from-Service-Desk/qaq-p/1169586], we found out that disabling the outgoing email will make the "Forgot your password?" link to be hidden in the customer portal login page and sometimes we may not think in this possibility.
It would be good that, when disabling the outgoing email, it shows a pop-up message informing everything that will be affected and a button to confirm and disable.
fields.summary: Add a pop up message to inform everything that will be affected when disabling outgoing email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Uploading svg files to the new issue view breaks after refreshing the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 Upload a svg file to new issue view > refresh > the text in it will break
 [^example.svg]

h3. Expected Results

The text in svg files should show appear as expected
h3. Actual Results

The text in svg files does not appear as expected
h3. Workaround

Use the old issue view
fields.summary: Text in svg files breaks in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users without _Browse users & groups_ permission are not able to add groups in the People section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Do not provide the user _Browse users & groups_ permission
 # Go to the People section of a project > Add People > Type site-admins or any existing group > no group comes up
 !Screenshot 2019-09-11 at 19.43.06.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The group name should be shown

h3. Actual Results
The group name should be shown

h3. Workaround
Provide the user  _Browse users & groups_ permission
fields.summary: People section does not show the group when the correct full name is typed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you receive a notification in the bell, on the left downside with a link on it, Jira will open it as an IFrame and not in a new tab.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate a notification that will show up in the bell on the left downside
 # Click on it and select the link add to it.

h3. Expected Results
It will open in a new tab the link you clicked.

h3. Actual Results
It opens in an IFrame.
 [^Notification Iframe.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Hold Ctrl/Command and click on the link or use the right button on the mouse, to open in a new tab.
fields.summary: Link in the Bell of Notifications open as an IFrame

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Including *sub-task* column in issue navigator lists sub-task's *issue keys* for each standard (parent) issue. The type of sub-task is not included in the issue navigator interface.

h3. Suggested resolution
Include sub-task type in issue navigator when sub-task field/column has been added. Sub-task type could be appeared as an icon similar to issue type.
fields.summary: Include sub-task type in issue navigator

fields.description: Why don't allow screenshots in this type of issue?
fields.summary: Ability to add screenshots for Jira suggestions =)

fields.description:
We often create large stories for the backlogg and split them into design, programming and art stories for the sprints. When I split a story, I would like to be able to change the issue type directly. Preferrably the issue type icon would be clickable (or mouse over) and present the offer to change issue type. 

This feature would also be handy in the backlogg.

It would save us lots of time and frustration.

!image-2019-09-11-11-04-08-026.png|width=436,height=294!

!image-2019-09-11-11-08-00-940.png|width=360,height=225!
fields.summary: Change issue type form icon

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Based on the [Markdown documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/markdown-formatting-in-jira-cloud-973480071.html], using a grave accent to highlight a word will transform it as Monospace format. However, in New Issue View, monospace formatting does not look like what it's shown in the documentation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Highlight a word with Grave Accent, for example: `Text`

h3. Expected Results
*  !image-2019-09-11-16-05-44-376.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
*  !image-2019-09-11-16-06-04-028.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Monospace format in New Issue View does not reflect the documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to change the issue type scheme for a project, the customer is getting Error 500.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the project's permission settings.
 # Choose the option *Choose a different permission scheme* from *Actions* drop-down
 # Click *Associate*

h3. Expected Results
 * Association to the project is successful

h3. Actual Results
 * Error 500 is returned (see below)
 !image.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 * Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: When trying to change the issue type scheme for Helpdesk project, the customer is facing Error 500.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When disabling *Time tracking* in the global settings, it is clearly noted that "_Time tracking for next-gen projects is always enabled_" when this is not correct and disabling the *Time Tracking* disables it for both Next-gen and Classic Projects.

 !Time_tracking_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Head to the *Time tracking* settings and disable it by switching the toggle off
# Attempt to log time on a Next-gen Issue

h3. Expected Results

As indicated in the message, Next-gen Projects should be unaffected by this and still be able to log time.

h3. Actual Results

Time tracking is disabled everywhere including Next-gen thus being unable to log time.
 
h3. Workaround

No workaround besides re-enabling Time tracking to be allowed to log work on Next-gen Issues. If the goal is to restrict time tracking for Classic Projects, this can be done through the [Permissions Scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-project-permissions-776636362.html].
fields.summary: Disabling Time tracking in global settings also disables it on Next-gen Projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira audit log shows "Project avatar changed" when access level has been changed in a next-gen project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Update access level in a next-gen project to *Private* | *Limited* | *Open*

h3. Expected Results
Jira audit log shows that project's access has been updated

h3. Actual Results
Jira audit log shows an event with *Project avatar changed* _change summary_

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Next-gen project access changes appears as "Project avatar changed"
Exporting sub-tasks (all fields) from next-gen project returns an error

fields.description:
In Jira, a Jira administrator can enable or disable subtasks. 

Currently, if the project has a subtask Issue Type and the subtasks are disabled, the button appears on the New Issue View but it does nothing if you click on it. 

h3. Suggestion
Remove the Create Subtask button from the New Issue View if the subtasks are disabled.
fields.summary: "Create Subtask" button should not appear if Subtasks are not enabled in the New Issue View

fields.description:
Summary

If you try to build a table via the new issue detail view, the final result will be in plain text:

!Screen Shot 2018-04-16 at 2.57.26 PM.png!

But if you go to the issue view and comment the very same table, it will work:
  !Screen Shot 2018-04-16 at 3.01.06 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-04-16 at 3.01.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 

It will even display correctly in the detail view:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-16 at 3.02.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 


It is the same behaviour with the description field.

Environment
 Jira Cloud

Steps to Reproduce
 * In a board view, click on a card (issue):
  ** Build a table in the comment field:
     ||Test||Task||
     |(/)|Test able rendering|

  ** Click on *Save* and check that the result is in plain text.
 * Now in the view screen of the very same issue, comment the same table. You will see that it will render correctly;
 * Get back to the issue's detail view, the last commented table will be correctly rendered as well.

Expected Results
 The table should render when you add a comment via the detail view as well.

Actual Results
 When commenting via the detail view, the result is plain text.

Workaround
 Create the table and add it as a new comment by copying and pasting inside the comment box.
fields.summary: Tables won't be rendered in the comments nor in the description if edited through the new issue detail view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Once a filter has some complexity into it, it is no longer possible to change to Basic search which allows searching for text. This prevents admins from being able to configure a complex filter and let their users to then narrow down results of those fields towards text.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow changing to basic search when the filter is complex to allow users to search by text
fields.summary: Allow changing to basic search when the filter is complex

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When copying path from Windows Explorer into the comment section in the new issue view will add additional "\ \" and causing the line to breaks

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy a path from *Windows Explorer*
 # Paste the path as a comment in the new issue view

h3. Expected Results
The path showing correctly without any line breaks

h3. Actual Results
Additional "\ \" causing the path not showing correctly
h3. Workaround
Add the comment in the old issue view by adding *?oldIssueView=true* from the issue URL e.g _https://instancename.atlassian.net/browse/<issue-key>?oldIssueView=true_
fields.summary: Path added as a comment in the new issue view added additional '\\'
REST API endpoint to export all users to CSV

fields.description:
Workaround:
h3. Issue Summary

In a dashboard with *Agile Wallboard gadget*, if the column view has more than 3 columns the issue links are not shown properly and users cannot open issues from the dashboard as links are not visible.
h3. Environment

Jira Software
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard with *Agile Wallboard gadget* and select an existing project board.
 # In the board, the issue links are not shown properly.

h3. Expected Results

Issue links should be shown on board
h3. Actual Results

Issue links are not shown properly
h3. Workaround

Changing the dashboard layout to show one gadget would display the issue links.
fields.summary: Agile wallboard gadget does not display the complete issue links

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA.Issue.getIssueId() doesn't work for Next-Gen based projects and NewIssue view with classic project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Browse to any NextGen project issue or any ClassicProject Issue with New-view only
 # Open Devtool >> Console
 # write below javascript and press enter
{code:java}
JIRA.Issue.getIssueId()  {code}

 # JIRA.Issue.getIssueId() - returns null

h3. Expected Results

JIRA.Issue.getIssueId() should return 'IssueId' as in below screenshot

!image-2019-09-02-17-21-39-464.png|width=452,height=53!

JIRA.Issue.getIssueKey() should return 'IssueKey'

!image-2019-09-02-17-21-57-957.png|width=291,height=76!
 *Note:* Above is working in ClassicProject with Old-Issue-View only.
h3. Actual Results

 Both JIRA.Issue.getIssueId() & JIRA.Issue.getIssueKey() - return null as in below screenshots

!image-2019-09-02-17-20-44-067.png|width=584,height=71!

!image-2019-09-02-17-21-12-946.png|width=260,height=47!
fields.summary: JIRA.Issue.getIssueId() doesn't work for Next-Gen based projects and NewIssue view with classic-Jira project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the default language of an instance is set to a different language than the user's default language preference, upon the issue creation event, the notification email will have it all translated according to the user's preference. However, the issue type name contained in the email will not be translated.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

This happens to the majority of the languages.
Here are the languages that have been tested so far:
* Korean (South Korea) - replicable
* Nederlands (Nederland) - replicable
* Russian (Russia) - replicable
* Hungarian (Hungary) - replicable
* Deutsch (German) - not replicable
* Portuguese - replicable

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the instance default language to one of the languages mentioned above (except for Deutsch - German)
 # Change your user preferential language to English
 # Create an issue ensuring that you'll receive the notification email (this includes the notifying you of your own changes setting)
 # Wait for the notification email and see the issue type name not being translated accordingly

h3. Expected Results
Issue type should be translated like the rest of the notification email.

h3. Actual Results
Issue type disrespects the user's language preference and uses the instance default language setting.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Issue type field on "Issue Created" notification email event does not respect the user default language

fields.description:
h3. Summary

CSV import (Issue navigator and External System Import) fails to create issues when user picker fields are set using email addresses or removed user (Example: reomved7). Following error appears for validation:
Issue navigator:
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-09 at 14.16.04.png|thumbnail! 

External system import (CSV):
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-09 at 14.24.19.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Go to the issue navigator or external system import features;
# Try to import the tickets using the reporter/assignee email address.
||summary||reporter||assignee||
|Test issue|testuser@test.com|testuser@test.com|
|Test issue 2|reomved7|removed7|


h3. Expected results

Tickets are imported using the email address and parsing to their accounts.
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-09 at 14.17.47.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

Jira throws an error and the tickets are not imported.
{noformat}
Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data may be in an unstable state: java.lang.NullPointerException: accountId: accountId
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Create a ticket with support at [here|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] asking for the CSV with email address and accountIDs
fields.summary: Import CSV fails to create issues when using email addresses for user picker fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The option "Account Settings" on the left downside is not working as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on your profile picture
 # Choose the option "Accounts Settings"

h3. Expected Results
Takes you to the expected page.

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't work as expected and throws the below message.

 !Account Settings.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, choose the option "Settings" above this option and you will be taken to the "Personal Settings".
fields.summary: Choosing the Option Account Settings is redirecting to the Wrong Page
Ability to adjust the display name of an attachment on new issue view

fields.description:
With a lot of developers we use the backlog filtering to look at all tasks a developer is doing and then we prioritize and add new tasks for that developer... but when you have your backlog filtered for Developer1 and you want to create a new task you can't assign Developer1 to the task immediately, so you create the task and it will be not visible but there is this banner saying "Your issue INK-4646 has been created but is not currently visible." and you have to click the "INK-4646" hyperlink to open the ticket and add the Developer1 as Assignee and then go back to backlog and then filter again for Developer1 and that is just super annoying.
Easiest solution I think, can you add a button on the banner ("Your issue INK-4646 has been created but is not currently visible.") which will add the ability to assign current filtered user to the ticket... e.g. "Assign Developer1 to ticket"
fields.summary: Add ticket to backlog while filtered by user

fields.description: It would be nice if the [Jira Cloud for Outlook|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Try-Jira-Cloud-for-Outlook-Organize-your-work-without-leaving/ba-p/1081661] was available and working in the Outlook Android app.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Outlook on Android App

fields.description:
h3. Summary
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Jira Cloud - New Issue View
 * MacOS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set Keyboard Language as Swiss German
 # Set Browser Language to German
 # Set Jira Settings as German
 # Set Personal Settings as German
 # Enter: `, space, text, `, space

h3. Expected Results

test
h3. Actual Results

`est`
h3. Workaround
 * Use the inline code button instead
 * write backtick first > space then enter text
fields.summary: Creating Inline code using syntax on Jira new issue view

fields.description:
h2. The Problem

Not all workflows start with an issue. And not all issues have just one branch addressing them. Finally, not all branches address only one issue. However, the only way to correctly connect an issue and a branch is by creating a new branch from an issue. Meanwhile, this often not how issues are addressed.
h2. Suggested Solution

Add a way to connect any existing issue with any existing branch in any connected VCS, regardless of creation order or name.
h2. Remarks

There is already a [question|[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-to-link-existing-JIRA-issue-to-a-existing-branch-in/qaq-p/701496]] about this in the Community website. A lot of people would like this implemented.
fields.summary: Ability to Link an Existing Issue to Any Existing Branch

fields.description: In the header of the active sprint backlog, there are color-coded (grey, blue, green) total story points for the issues in different phases. Can you extend that marking to the grey number at the end of the line of each individual issue? That way it is so much easier to see the status of the issues in  the current sprint.
fields.summary: Mark 'Not started', 'In progress' and 'Done' issues in active sprint backlog with corresponding colors

fields.description:
As an administrator, it would be handy to have the ability to increase the email processing time limit for mail handler from currently 7 days to the desired number of days. This article https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-779288896.html explains this limitation.

 !Screen Shot 2019-09-09 at 4.23.30 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to increase email processing time limit from 7 days

fields.description:
I would like to edit the issue in real-time with other team-member as I can to in Wrike or in Google Docs.

It makes interaction faster and safer (as now it's a problem if two users edit the issue at the same time).
fields.summary: NEXT-GEN Concurrent edit of issue description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When mentioning a user, the notifications received in text format uses the AccountID instead of the readable display name. This makes the mention notation unusable in the notification. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As User A, go to Personal Settings
 # Change the _Email notifications format_ from HTML to Text
 # Mention User A in a Jira comment
 # Check the notification email. 

h3. Expected Results

The mention should indicate the name of the user being mentioned. 

{code}
[~UserA]
[~UserA:accountid]
{code}

h3. Actual Results

The mention is only indicating the AccountID

{code}
[~accountid:xxxxxxxxxxxx]
{code}

 !mention.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

As the receiving user, switch to HTML notifications.
fields.summary: Mentions in text format notifications uses the accountID

fields.description:
It would be great to always have my starred projects at the top.

As a project manager I have access to 20+ projects.

I always star my current projects in the hope that I will be able to spot them. However they often appear on a second page, and are not visible.

If I can order my projects by starred items on the BrowseProjects.jspa page, I will be able to get to work much quicker.
fields.summary: Order Projects by Starred Items

fields.description:
*Problem definition*
 * The user gets a misleading error message Eg: *Connection Failed* when the user doesn't have the permission to create space in *Confluence* via Jira Pages functionality

 * 
 ** !image-2019-09-06-13-44-14-804.png|width=343,height=150!

*Suggested solution*
 * To have a direct message. Eg: *You do not have the permission to create space in Confluence* kindly contact your site-admin for access
fields.summary: Create Confluence space from Jira error message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There are several default system groups added in Global permissions
i.e
Administrators, atlassian-addons-admin, system-administrators and trusted-users-<number>

The intention for the request is, as the site admins of instance, need to make sure who should have the permission to access the site. They  have also grouped users so that it can add the corresponding groups on the Global Permission page. 
However, there are some system groups that don't use and even cannot find them, which makes us worry about there might cause security breach in the worst case.

h3. Notes

Access Global permissions in Jira/Confluence and we can see the default system groups. This should be hidden or given ability to site-admins to remove the group

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Allow site-admins to determine the system groups in Global permissions page

fields.description:
There's one thing I adore more than anything in this day and age of constant fighting for my attention. I want to see what I need to see, and not more.

I want to be able to quickly choose a default category and/or a default type.
fields.summary: Add functionality to choose default views for Software Projects

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to disable the attachment preview in the issue view. So, to download attachments you need to click on the file thumbnail (which will open the file preview) and only then click on Download.

Implementing this ability would make possible to download attachments by simply clicking on the file thumbnail.

!print.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to disable attachment preview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Referring to the [Basic auth for REST APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-basic-authentication/] documentation taking notice of the Depreciation notice:
{quote}*(!) Using passwords with Jira REST API basic authentication*

Support for passwords in REST API basic authentication is [deprecated and will be removed in the future|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/deprecation-notice-basic-auth-and-cookie-based-auth/]. While the Jira REST API currently accepts your Atlassian account password in basic auth requests, we _strongly_ recommend that you use API tokens instead. We expect that support for passwords will be deprecated in the future and advise that all new integrations be created with API tokens.
{quote}
Following the given example of a base 64 encoded <USER_NAME:API_Token> passed in basic auth request fails with 401 unauthorized

Environment
 * Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a base64 encoded username:API_token
 ## to do this you Can use the command "echo username:API_token | openssl base64 | tr -d '\n' | pbcopy" to create the token and copy to clipboard
 # Use the Base64 EXE from the article with your encoded token:

{quote}
h2. Supplying basic auth headers

If you need to, you may construct and send basic auth headers yourself. To do this you need to perform the following steps:
 # Generate an API token for Jira using your Atlassian Account: [https://id.atlassian.com/manage/api-tokens].
 # Build a string of the form {{useremail:api_token}}.
 # BASE64 encode the string.
 # Supply an {{Authorization}} header with content {{Basic}} followed by the encoded string. For example, the string {{fred:fred}} encodes to {{ZnJlZDpmcmVk}} in base64, so you would make the request as follows:

Copy
{{12345}}{{curl -D- \
   -X GET \
   -H "Authorization: Basic ZnJlZDpmcmVk" \
   -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
   "https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/QA-31"}}{quote}
h3. Expected Results

Action completes 200 OK
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown:
{noformat}
$ curl -D- -X GET -H "Authorization: Basic <BASE64 encoded username:token here>" -H "Content-Type: application/json" "https://exedomain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/EXE-123"
HTTP/2 401 
server: AtlassianProxy/1.15.8.1
www-authenticate: OAuth realm="https%3A%2F%2Fexedomain.atlassian.net"
content-type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
strict-transport-security: max-age=315360000; includeSubDomains; preload
{noformat}
h3. Notes

The Deprecation Notice specifically flags Deprecation of password in basic auth and notes to use API token instead, and need clarification if this was intentional for the Base64 encoded option to also include token removal as well
h3. Workaround

Do not use Basic Auth pass in the header and instead use the direct -u usernam:token unencoded format from the simple example section:
{quote}
h2. Simple example

Most client software provides a simple mechanism for supplying a user name (in our case, the email address) and password (or API token) that it then uses to build the required authentication headers automatically. For example, you can specify the {{-u}} argument with cURL as follows:
Copy
{{12345}}{{curl -D- \
   -u fred@example.com:freds_api_token \
   -X GET \
   -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
   https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta}}{quote}
fields.summary: API token encoded as Base64 in basic Auth fails with 401

fields.description:
Please never remove RECENT ISSUES. I would be totally lost without this feature.

Can you maybe expand it a bit? I have a 4k screen so there's plenty of room to show at least 2x many items. Please! [pic.twitter.com/O6GX80XUiL|https://t.co/O6GX80XUiL]

[https://twitter.com/capajj/status/1169611249900015616]
fields.summary: Option to load more issues in the Recent issues view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In New issue view Issue transitions to the status before screen information part of transition is filled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a transition from *Status A* to *Status B* and associate a screen to it
# transition the issue from *Status A* to *Status B*

h3. Expected Results
A screen appears and once you *close* the screen, the status of the issue is moved to *Status B*

h3. Actual Results
The issue transitions to *Status B* in the background and the associated  screen appears

h3. Notes
Not raised this as a bug because if you *cancel* the screen the issue moves back to the previous status which is *Status A* in this case
fields.summary: In New issue view Issue transitions to the status before screen information part of transition is filled

fields.description: In Confluence Cloud, Atlassian provides atl.general web panel location which we are using for displaying Banner Type announcements. It would be nice if atl.general OR something similar is provided for Jira as well.
fields.summary: In webPanels module, please provide 'atl. general' OR something similar which can be available across all pages

fields.description:
In Confluence Cloud, Atlassian provides atl.footer web panel location which we use to make a REST API call.

It would be nice if atl.footer OR something similar is provided in Jira as well.
fields.summary: In webPanels module, please provide 'atl.footer' OR something similar which can be available across all pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding an image to a comment on the new issue view, the image preview is sent on the notification email. However, those images are broken in the email notification

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using the new issue view, add an image to a comment on an issue;
 # Check the notification email received by the comment added event.

h3. Expected Results

The image will be present in the notification email and visible. 

h3. Actual Results

The image is broken on the email notification
* !image broken.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

A workaround will be to use the "old" view to add images on comments.
fields.summary: Images add on comments in the new issue view are broken in the email notification

fields.description:
*Problem definition*
 * The user gets a generic error message such as *Something has gone wrong* when the user doesn't have the Jira application as shown below:
 **  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

*Suggested solution*
 * To have a direct message. Eg: *You do not have the Jira application access* kindly contact your site-admin for access
fields.summary: Jira Error message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On Slack, Jira comment notifications with external link is broken by duplicates link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Finder/File Explorer, right-click on the dropbox filename and select "Copy Dropbox Link", 
# Paste external link on Jira comment section. 

h3. Expected Results
Single link notified Slack

h3. Actual Results
link on Jira comment (looks fine on Jira): 
{code}
https://www.dropbox.com/s/<number>/filename.txt?dl=0
{code}

Duplication is seen displayed on Slack: 
{code}
https://www.dropbox.com/s/<number>/filename.txt?dl=0%7Chttps://www.dropbox.com/s/<number>/filename.txt?dl=0%7Csmart-link
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: On Slack, Jira comment notifications with external link is broken by duplicates link (Mac-specific).

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Time Since Issues Report, when Status Category Changed option is selected in State Field and tried to get the report, 500 internal server error is shown.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to a Jira instance
# Open a Business/Software project > Reports
# Click on Time Since Issues Report
# Select Status Category Changes in Date Field and try to run the report

h3. Expected Results
Time Since Issues report should show the report data

h3. Actual Results
An internal server error page is shown

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Time Since Issues Reports throws a 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When cloning an issue in the new issue view, the attachments in the issue summary breaks

h3. Environment
Jira cloud new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue with attachment added to the summary or description
# Clone the newly created  issue above
# Observe the new issue.

h3. Expected Results
The attachment shows in summary

h3. Actual Results
The attachment is broken 

h3. Workaround
Switch to the old issue view
fields.summary: Cloned issue attachment broken in new issue view
The ability to paste a Confluence table into an issue comment is broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing a ticket directly from the notification center, you will be redirected to the comment link of the issue (?focusedCommentId=12774&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-12774) on the old issue view. 

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Opens a ticket and ask someone to mention you on a comment;
# Using your user, click on the bell icon and open the ticket using the notification;
# You will be redirected to the old issue view.

h3. Expected results

Jira should redirect the user to the new issue view comment.

h3. Actual result

Jira is redirecting the user to the comment link (?focusedCommentId=12774&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-12774) on the old issue view comment.
 !Screen Recording 2019-09-04 at 04.56 PM.gif!

h3. Workaround

Remove the {{focusedCommentId}} part of the ticket's URL.
fields.summary: When accessing a ticket from the notification center you will be redirected to the old issue view

fields.description: I would like to be able to access my past sprints in ways other than searches so I can look at the reports on them. I would also like a summary for the sprint with charts that compares the percentage of tickets, bugs vs new features vs improvements, etc. One that would compare the number of story points so I can understand what a sprint went to when not focused on a major feature.
fields.summary: Summary Report for Sprints and Access
